title: Here Comes Kang Xi to bid goodbye?
text:
Here Comes Kang Xi to bid goodbye? Kevin Tsai bids adieu to Taiwan variety talk show Here Comes Kang Xi. Photo: Facebook Kevin Tsai bids farewell on social media Published: 4:25 PM, October 16, 2015 Updated: 4:35 PM, October 16, 2015 
SINGAPORE — Could this be the end of popular Taiwanese variety talk show Here Comes Kang Xi? 
In a post on social media sites Facebook and Weibo, Here Comes Kang Xi presenter Kevin Tsai said it was time to bid the show goodbye. 
“The first person I told was, of course, (my onscreen partner) Dee Hsu. After that, I submitted my resignation to my boss Wang Wei-Chung. I told him, ‘I’d like to make some changes. The show is about to turn 12 years old.’ I’d like to thank our colleagues, who have worked very hard. I hope they think it’s been worth it,” Tsai wrote. 
Hsu later acknowledged his post on her own Facebook page, saying she would stand with him and that the show would not be complete without him, sparking rumours that the show will therefore end with Tsai’s departure. 
Here Comes Kang Xi, one of Taiwan’s most popular talk shows, has been nominated for numerous Golden Bell Awards since its debut in 2004. Its presenters, Tsai and Hsu, were also awarded Best Host In A Variety Programme at the Golden Bell Awards in 2005.
